description: Buy the Fishpond Tacky Daypack 2X Fly Box online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tacky Daypack 2X Fly Box
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fishpond Tacky Daypack 2X Fly Box online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Writing a review here to offset the 2 star as I don't think it is accurate. I have this fly box and really like it. The magnets rather than having any latches are very convenient. This is a slim fly box and I really like that. It fits in my small sling pack and my waders really well while I'm tying something new. I do skip rows just for easy access on some flies (the other review is correct in that you probably won't get 360 flies in there). That said, just get a bigger flybox if that's what you want as this is a much better space saving option.
review.name: Great minimalist fly box

review.reviewBody: This is a very compact fly box, approximately the size and width of a smart phone.  The Tacky silicone grips flies tenaciously--even small flies stay put.  Like all Tacky boxes, this box displays flies nicely with each fly in its own "docking station" and abundant space between flies.  Your flies can do yoga inside this box.  The capacity, however is grossly overstated (360 flies!).  Theoretically you could insert two flies facing each other in each docking station but this is only possible with very small flies-- size #20 or smaller.  For nymphs in the size 14 to 18 range the capacity of this box is half of what is stated.  That is certainly a reasonable number and if you want a compact box to carry a decent selection of nymphs to the stream this box can do that.  But do not expect to fill the box to the stated capacity unless you stock the box exclusively with micro patterns.
review.name: Not a High Capacity Box

name: Tacky Daypack 2X Fly Box

review.itemreviewed: Arizona Platform Papillio Narrow Sandal - Women's

It’s this particular shoe that is the problem.  Unfortunately regret this purchase.

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Skyline 23L Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Skyline 23L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Skyline 23L Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just bought this bag for myself and my son. Holds a ton of climbing gear!  Looks like a small pack but is surprisingly large.
review.name: An amazing pack!

review.reviewBody: Have been using this bag daily for about a month and love it
review.name: Excellent bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack about a year ago when I started taking more gear to the crag. This pack holds all of my climbing gear plus a 32 oz Nalgene, a small med kit, and some other gear (and snacks). I have not had a single problem or come across any limiting factor with this pack for what I use it for: climbing, which is what it was designed for. I own several other Mystery Ranch packs, and I am happy to say that this holds up to the quality of what they are known for.
review.name: Well Purposed

review.reviewBody: I climb indoors with my wife going back and forth between top rope and bouldering. We were struggling with all of our equipment in other bags often enough due to the stickiness of the shoes and the harnesses. This bag fits two pairs of shoes, two adult harnesses, one kid's harness, and three chalk bags with space left for a hydro flask and snacks. I'm excited to see the bag grow with me as I start to lead climb and acquire more equipment and rope. The material is tough and the blue is super vibrant. Absolutely love this bag.
review.name: Great bag for all your climbing needs!

review.reviewBody: Not what I expected after using Mystery Ranch's firefighting packs for years. Without going into too much detail, it is oddly setup with a lot of wasted space where I would expect pockets to be. It is designed for a lumbar hydration pack, not the regular upright rectangular type. Its not terrible but maybe they should stick to industrial and not consumer end/"urban" packs.
review.name: Appealing aesthetic, weirdly designed wasted space

review.reviewBody: Purchased 6 weeks ago. Well constructed. Packed full of useful features for a day pack. Dual grab handles are great for carrying or clipping the bag into anchor 200 feet up. The rip top provides easy access without the hassle of spilling your gear. The size is perfect for day trips and discourages over packing.
review.name: Functional

review.reviewBody: I bought this for day rides.  I usually carry about 15 to 20 lbs: tools 3 liters of gas and 1.5L of water and sometimes a lunch.  This pack is really tough.  The 1000 denier is what sold me on it.  I've put about 500 miles on it.  I haven't had any real good crashes, but I think it will really hold up over time.  It is very compact and sits tightly in the high center of my back when riding.  It's very stable through small jumps, whoops, chop, and turns.  I'm not at all worried about getting hooked on trees or tight brush with this pack.  I did switch out the waist belt with a 1.5 inch belt, which was very easy to swap out.  The belt sits high and the shoulder straps are too tight, but after dropping the sternum strap as low as I could, It rides comfortable enough on 100 mi 3 hr rides.  On longer rides/heavier loads, my shoulders get sore, but balanced with its rugged construction this is a compromise I am willing to make at this time.  I use a 1.5 liter bladder bag that works great with the packs features.  I was able to strap my License plate onto existing loops via para cord and quick clips.    6foot tall 220lbs.
review.name: Single Track Moto

review.reviewBody:
I bought this pack to carry with me on long multi-pitched climbs and have since used it for multiple climbs, hikes, and mountain bike excursions. The pack is big enough to hold my entire rack plus water for the approach and rope is easily held with the side straps. I really appreciate the abrasion resistant material so I'm not worried about damaging the pack. I was concerned the thin shoulder straps would cut into me on longer approaches, but this proved to be a non-issue. I appreciate the easy opening. 
In summary the Skyline 23 has done everything I wanted it to and I have no complaints. Excellent pack.
review.name: As advertised

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack as a bug out bag, it was a little small for this but turned out to be the perfect work pack. Computer, binder, coffee & big Yeti container. Room for more if needed
review.name: MR Quality on all levels

review.reviewBody:
If your looking for a cram and go pack then this is a good choice. Ordered 2 because the price was right and colors were acceptable unlike other expensive Mystery Ranch packs w/the kaki or Multicam which I hate. Wearing those colors everyday in the Army is enough for me, don’t want it on my daily use gear. My girl was happy with the Skyline-23 in Tiger Orange and I got the blk.
  We only been using them for about 3weeks and the 1000D is what it is “durable”, but the material on the back and shoulder straps of the packs feel pretty cheep not like the rest of the material which is pretty well made. We’re not climbers and we got these for our daily grind so I’m overall happy with them.
  If I were to complain I would have to say they need more pockets, a bottle holder for water, or wallet etc. Im having molle sewn
 to mine because I can’t live without that 
option although initially I thought I could. And also the shoulder straps which probably won’t hold up to some of the stuff I do with my other packs like weighted force marches.
Which is the main reason I didn’t give these
 packs 5 ⭐️’s. For an urban option I think this pack is right on but I’ll stick to my Maxpedition for my outdoor needs.
These did the trick for my daily gym or run though and you get a quality pack for the money. I’d purchase again if had to do it all over.
review.name: Skyline-23

name: Skyline 23L Daypack

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'2", 175lbs. I've had a size M in these pants that fit me perfectly. Ordered another pair because they fit so well. This med was so small that I couldn't close the waist or fit kneepads. Returned for another pair. This M had the correct size waist but cut like "hammer" pants as others have described. Very disappointed because these have the potential to be great pants. If you order, I wish you better luck.
review.name: very inconsistent sizing

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'1" and weigh about 185 pounds, so I ordered a size L. The waist fits great and the length is good, but these things are baggy! I don't know why they are cut the way they are, but I wouldn't even be able to ride in these. The quality seems awesome, and they're quite comfortable, but waaaay too baggy for trail riding. I'm bummed out because they seem really awesome other than the fit.
review.name: Sizing is off

review.reviewBody: Cut is perfect on these pants. Most cyclists have larger thighs and these pants accommodate that and kneepads underneath. I've owned these for 3 years and they have held up well with very little signs of wear.
review.name: Tailor Made for cyclists

review.reviewBody:
6'1", 184#, normally size L/ 33 waist, 34 inseam
Bought size L, fit well, waist was a little snug but no complains.
Cut is funky- MC Hammer pants.  I understand extra for knee pads but these are kinda ridiculous.
Quality and sewing is great. Material is a little stretchy.  Look like a quality pant.  I'm returning mine due to the flappy fit.
review.name: MC Hammer pants

name: SingleTrack Trouser II - Men's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Sabretooth Clip Crampon online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sabretooth Clip Crampon
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Sabretooth Clip Crampon online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Reliable, steal crampons. I've used them on many mountains in the Alps and in the PNW and they do exactly what they're supposed to. They are easy to adjust on the fly for my different mountaineering boots and ski boots, it's extremely convenient. They stay on and I've never had a problem.
The Easy on and off crampons stuck to the ice even in wet and watery conditions
review.name: Glacier travel in the cascades

review.reviewBody:
I bought these in preparation for mountaineering, which I haven't yet done; however, I did test them out when I hiked up a ski mountain in the summer that was still covered in snow, and skied down with my alpine skis. The snow was quite steep still, and very icy. I was using a pair of trekking boots, as I don't have mountaineering ones yet. I found my adventure to be quite challenging because the spikes worked great, but only for a couple steps until they fell off my feet. The reason for this being that these spikes are made to attach to mountaineering boots that have a type of peg on the toe. 

In the photos here, it shows that you can take the strap for the ankle and wrap it down, in , and out of the part that goes over your toe, than back up to finish around the ankle. Unfortunately, this doesn't work because the strap just doesn't stay secure, especially around the ankle. I don't see any other way of these staying on properly without having the type of peg on your mountaineering boots. I'm quite disappointed as these are not inexpensive, and I still haven't found a pair of boots with the right peg (not many options, and I have difficult feet). I really wish that this was mentioned in the description here, or on the Black Diamond site. I find the photo misleading because this method of attaching the spikes simply doesn't work- they literally fell off my feet after a couple steps every time (and I tried a lot!). With that said, the spikes were really impressive, I wasn't able to use them a lot, however I felt like I could trust them. With them repetitively falling off, the metal bar that attaches the spikes under the heal and the ones under the toes actually fell out. It was possible to put the spikes back together once at home, but not a pleasant experience on a steep, icy slope. Moral of the story: always, always do test runs with your equipment before hand!
review.name: Don't stay attached to your feet if you aren't using mountaineering boots with a peg on the toe

review.reviewBody: These are the first crampons I've owned, but I can't imagine anything working better. From ease of transition to confidence inspiring, solid stability on the ice, I highly recommend these. It might be worth noting that these have two front teeth instead of the more traditional single "toe" and two "secondary".
review.name: Two 6k ft ascents

review.reviewBody: These crampons worked great for me on Denali. Seamlessly fit all boots I've tried them on with and made the transition easy when I switched mountaineering boots a week before my trip.
review.name: All around great crampons

review.reviewBody: Fairly lightweight, bomber construction, and simple/easy function; these are the ski boot crampons for me.
I want to replace this with the same product with clips. The pro version is restrictive. Sadly no returns otherwise I want it replace with the Sabretooth with clip.
had a 10 miles day hike in Minnewaska a month ago, tons of snow and ice, without the crampon, i don't think i could come back home safely.
review.name: very effective

review.reviewBody: Easy on, easy off. Reliable straps. They let you trust your feet and worry about more important things.
review.name: Great for low angle ice, glaciers

review.reviewBody: Fits a little weird around the toe of my k2 pinnacle boots but not to the point where it's an issue. Has worked quite well so far. Early summer hardpack and steep slush to deep winter treks.

name: Sabretooth Clip Crampon

hasVariant.name: Quilted Military Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stoic Quilted Military Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: great for those days when it’s in the 50s or 60s.
review.name: simply comfortable

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket both as a house jacket and light weight jacket, super comfortable.  I am 6'1 and weigh 210, I ordered both the large and medium and the medium fits great but the large was too big and baggy although my chest is 44" and that's what the chart recommended.  I'd say the large is for people who normally wear an XXL shirt size.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody:
Definitely a relaxed fit as advertised.  I'm typically a men's Large, regular fit or an XL, slim fit BUT the Medium in this quilted jacket fit great.  I originally bought the Large but it's just too baggy, sleeves are too long and torso too tall unless you're at least 6' 2" & around 215 lbs or higher.  I'm assuming an XL (in this jacket) would be for someone > 250 lbs.

Nice solid colors, great design.  The threads do shed & unravel a little bit but not noticeable & doesn't undermine the overall quality.  I give it a 4.5 out of 5.0 for Looks & a 5.0 out of 5.0 if purchased for $40 or less).  In no way was this jacket ever worth $99 (unless you think $19 for two tacos is cheap) but at half that much, it's probably a great find.
review.name: Attractive quilted shirt-jacket

review.reviewBody:
This thing is dope! Super comfy and the perfect weight for my needs.

I was looking for something to wear indoors on chilly mornings. As I work from home frequently, my old hoody seemed a little too ratty for zoom calls and a cardigan seemed a little too Fred Rogers. This thing's perfect! As an added bonus, I can wear it as an outer layer in the summer when the temp drops in the evening.
The fabric has a soft hand and is stretchy. The seems are bound on the inside with contrast piping. I thought that was a nice touch.
Sizing is right on. The arm's are long-ish... probably about 36.5" on Large. Fits better than the sherpa fleece.
review.name: Stylish Sweatshirt

review.reviewBody:
Can be worn inside on cold days or outside in warmer weather. The sizing is right on. The cuffs are loose so you can push up the sleees if you want.
It has a helft to the padding that is nice and makes the garmet hang nicely. Yet it is thin for a quilted jacket.
review.name: Stylish layer to have

name: Quilted Military Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Size: These are a size L.  I am 5’4”, approx 168 lbs, 34E bra, 28” inseam, long torso especially boobs to hip area.  These fit comfortably and with the adjustable straps I can adjust for my long waist.  I do have them cuffed once which did not get in the way when biking and looks kinda cute especially off the bike. 

Pockets: One large zippered pocket on my chest which fit my keys and phone and room for a bit more. Has hip and booty pockets too but they lack closures.  I wish the hip pockets had closures and may try and add something to close them with.  

Performance on the bike: I rode in the mid 80s for an hour and a half last night and got a touch warm but that would be true for bike pants too.  No shifting around, no catching on my chain or chain ring even riding an aggressive, fast DH jump line for the majority of the ride.  I like how they just stay up and don’t need messed with.  Plenty of room for knee pads.  I have Fox enduro d30 on but there’s room for beefier pads.  

Off the bike style: Super cute and I’ve seen styled with blundstone boots and a cute top.  Even hubs liked them!  They’re easy to get in and out of for changing or bathroom trips.  Step into the middle of the straps and pull up then bring the straps up.  I don’t have to unbutton the sides since there’s a stretch panel.
review.name: 10/10 recommend

name: Life Bib - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Super Couloir Sensor Glove - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Got these for a chilly January trip through Utah and they performed exactly like I had hoped. Warm, waterproof, but still having enough dexterity to function.
review.name: Warm, weatherproof

review.reviewBody: I got this pair as a warranty replacement for a similar style that is no longer available. They are excellent gloves and I look forward to many years of service. I continue to purchase OR equipment because it well designed and good quality, but maybe more importantly because of the Infinite Guarantee. They stand behind what they sell and that means a lot to me.
review.name: Awesome equipment, exceptional warranty

review.reviewBody: These are no doubt the warmest, highest quality gloves I’ve ever used. Took them on a winter backpacking and ski mountaineering trip to Mount Washington, NH with extreme winds and negative temps and they held up no problem. These are 10/10, no question.
review.name: Bomber Gloves

review.reviewBody: Kept my fingers warm while it was raining. The size runs a little small.
review.name: Good warm gloves

review.reviewBody: The good? Typical OR quality that you would expect. I'm certain these are as durable as they feel and are rated by OR themselves, and for certain applications they will certainly be great. But...not for the suggested applications which are what I bought them for. I in particular wanted these for downhill and backcountry skiing, and intended to use them in general winter outdoors excursions. Where these miss in particular are sizing and warmth. I have currently in my "collection" 6 pairs of OR gloves and mitts, all of them are a size 9 Large and these fit way too tight. I have thin fingers and they're a bit too snug, both in feel and compared to all my other OR gloves. Usually, with my lanky fingers, I can slip on a pair of wool glove liners and still fit gloves on just fine, but not with the Super Couloirs. these have been relegated to -5C territory for me, whereas I was looking for a super reliable -10 to -15C glove. I was swapping to my Aksel Work Gloves when I was in -30 to -35 temps. I was honestly finding them warmer than the Super Couloirs. Waterproofing is a questionable area for me. These aren't rated as the most waterproof glove that OR and that's ok...but in the 0 to -5 range they're going to wet. So far this season, they haven't soaked through but they have wetted significantly. The cuff is a great length though, and the leashes (that also come on other glove models) are fantastic. And hey, they look good too. My recommendations are to consider sizing up from your normal size, and consider if your hands run hot or cold. Mine seem to be middle of the pack compared to my friends, so maybe these are more suited to those with naturally warmer hands. I also wonder if these were cutting off some of my blood flow. Not that they're super tight, but that snug fit certainly can't be helping me. I would have exchanged for a larger size had I not used them already. I thought when trying them on that they would be alright in the end.
review.name: Missed the mark

review.reviewBody: Easy to put, and so warm for the cold Canadian weather. Perfect, and I love the color!
review.name: Just as expected!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit and comfortable with the preformed fingers. Keeps cold and wet out while keeping good dexterity. Material has proven to be pretty rugged, even when handling wood and tools.
review.name: Great fit. Durable.

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) These gloves are super warm in the winter. I have a pair of heavy duty black diamond ski gloves. I find these ones warmer and more durable.
review.name: Good Warm Ski Gloves

review.reviewBody: Very warm gloves, comfortable. The pull loops work well. I dont wear gloves on the hill without leashes and these ones are comfortable and work great. I do find that the touch screen touch on these to not work as well as other gloves I have had in the past. Maybe as they soften a bit with use they will work better. The sensor touch is a major reason I love the outdoor research gloves.
review.name: Great cold weather glove

review.reviewBody: I put a full ski season on these gloves and they’ve held up very well. I love the wrist straps and the pull-loops on the gauntlet are great for getting them on. They just didn’t keep my hands as warm as I’d like. My fingers started getting cold when it was only mid 20s F on the mountain, which is very odd for me as I very seldomly get cold. Had to get some liners.
review.name: Not as warm as I wanted

name: Super Couloir Sensor Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Weird design, hurt my head. Can't return it bc final sale. Don't buy.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: All of the ski/snowboard helmets come pretty much standard in the same sizes ex., Medium: 55-59 cm, Large: 59-63 cm. My head measures 57 cm so I order the Medium well it didn't fit it was too snug and felt pressure points on the sides of my head mostly on the temple and above my ears. However, if I order the Large it fits not snug at all even if I dial the thing all the way up it still feels like some kind of play.
review.name: Not that great fit

review.reviewBody: Here is the design on the back of the black helmet...
review.name: Design on Black Helmet

review.reviewBody: First off, this helmet is sweet! It fits like you want it to, is lightweight and warm, and even has a subtle design on the back of the black version courtesy of Chris Benchetler. I used it for about 15 days before my accident. I was skiing at Solitude off of the Summit chair and clipped my head on a tree, tumbling down about 50 yards thereafter. I would be in a very different situation right now if I wasn't wearing this helmet. I am ordering another one right now.
review.name: Saved me...

name: Four Amid Pro Helmet

review.itemreviewed: Pro Dry Nanoweight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Super lightweight and very comfortable. I was worried about tearing it when I first got it because it feels so thin but no issues. The seams are heat closed so nothing to rub when you start to get really sweaty. 

I am either a medium or a large depending on brand and this medium fits me really well
review.name: Awesome Baselayer

review.itemreviewed: Pro Dry Nanoweight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I never thought ADDING a layer will make you cooler. But it does, it really does. This mesh top is amazingly light and soft and once on under your jersey (and bib straps) it does a great job letting more air from the jersey evaporate the sweat on your skin. You can actually feel the cooling effect, especially if you get like a gust of wind from a different direction. 
They are awesome. Will order more (when my size comes back.)
review.name: Regular part of my warm-weather gear

name: Pro Dry Nanoweight Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Super comfortable and fits true to
Size. Little stiff at first but loosened up nicely.
review.name: Great

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product free from Influenster to test and give my honest opinion. The Ona Ave Women’s Waterproof Lace Boots are built solidly. Tried them on while taking my Melly Moo for a walk and can definitely say they are waterproof and non-slippery. At first they feel stiff, but once I put them in they were comfortable. I will say that they fit loose on my ankles.
review.name: Great Investment

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love boots, and have since I was a kid. Good boots are worth a big price in my opinion too. These boots met and exceeded my expectations. These are a size 8 US Women's, and at first the width of the shoe was a little tight. That passed within a few days as I laced them differently and settled into them. I wear them everywhere-to the dentist, exploring outdoors, and going shopping. I haven't felt like they would slip once, and they felt secure on grass, sidewalks, wet pavement, and mopped areas. They absolutely live up to being waterproof. I do wish the laces were longer, but I can get another pair of laces easily. It would be cool to have had a little insert in the package to give advice on how to care for the boots to preserve them well.
review.name: Met and exceeded expectations

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow! I cannot believe the beauty of these boots. This is the nicest pair of boots I have ever worn. I've always been a huge ugg fan, I own about 10 pairs, but they do NOTHING to keep feet safe from water! These boots on the other hand are waterproof and stylish! I wasn't sure if I liked the look of them when I first glanced at them but the more I umboxed the more appreciated the design. By my first wear I had fallen as in love as you can with a boot. They are not only comfortable but slip proof! These bad boys, or should I say girls, are heavy duty but look so slim and feminine. I usually wear a 9.5 to 10. Sometimes 9 depending on the shoe, and a size 9 in these fit great! In fact any larger and they might have been a little too loose. I'm really blown away by these boots. I cannot wait for the winter/snowy season this year!
review.name: Wow!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are awesome boots. Not only are they very stylish but they're comfortable as well. They're very warm which makes sense but I will still wear them year round because they're so great. Can't wait to see how they hold up over time!
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was in complete awe with these waterproof lace boots. They were absolutely gorgeous, super stylish.  They're were tire true to size,  very comfy, a little heavy, but all in all great boots.
review.name: Really nice boots!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These Ona Ave boots look great! I love that they’re waterproof and appear extremely durable. I love the side zipper, making slipping them on a breeze. They are comfortable although a bit stiff, as new boots sometimes are, and I’m sure there will be a “breaking in” period which will yield a perfectly comfortable fit. Ona Ave are stylish and will be highly coveted as the staple to my fall and winter wardrobe out here in the country. Midwest winters are brutal and these boots with their durable construction make me want to go out and tackle the environment in style!
review.name: Great looking waterproof boots!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect boot for the transition from fall into winter. They are comfortable without having to break them in. The best part is that they are waterproof, so good for rain and snow. Fits true to size and the tread on the bottom has a nice grip to it. Overall a great addition to my fall/winter wardrobe.
review.name: Waterproof and chic

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are very pretty!! I thought I was getting something else but I was happily surprised. I’m a 7.5 in women boots because I have flat feet’s so I ordered an 8. These boots fit a little big so get your normal size because you can loosened them up from the laces. When I wore it I ran, bent down, wore it for at least 6 hours straight each time and I never had pain on my feet or heals. It has a side zipper on the inside of your foot I tend to prefer boots like that it is more comfortable for me as a flat foot person to wear the boots. Anyways they are cute many people that saw me wearing them the different times I wore it gave me compliments. They are water proof so that’s a plus because where I live it rains a lot so I won’t keep having to switch shoes. The only thing I can say is that they get scuffed easily since its a smooth leather material but I don’t care because you can’t really tell unless you take them off and look at it up close. Also I got a crease from bending which for me its normal because I’m in between sizes and happens to all my shoes even the ones that are basically a glove to my feet. Anyways I would recommend this if you’re not a person that cares too much about the little stuff like a crease.
review.name: Overall it’s a comfortable and pretty shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are so comfy! They fit great and have sturdy soles and great traction . They're great looking boots and definitely classy feeling. I'm looking forward to fall and winter with these!
review.name: Cant wait for fall and winter!

name: Ona Ave Lace WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Yup. The trouble I had with the Birkenstock site is not to be believed. They sent me a completely different order & when I contacted them to fix it, they sent me ANOTHER incorrect order! At the end of the day, “oh so sorry we are out of that item”😑
I honestly was not surprised because customer service is essentially nonexistent in today’s world (in my experience anyway). 
Hail Backcountry 🙌🏼 Should’ve ordered here in the first place. 
I’ve got lots of Birkenstock shoes. I wear a 7.5-8 but I am a nurse on my feet 12 hours so I get the 39 in birks. I get the 38 in Danskos because they run a wee bit large.
review.name: Buy HERE not Birkenstock site

review.reviewBody: I got this jacket a month ago and since I’ve used it during heavy rain in the city and during winter mountain climbs. I can say I’ve had no issues with the waterproofing. In the winter mountain, this jacket became irreplaceable for me. Being so light and breathable is such a game changer- I sweat much less, less need to stop for water and I feel much less exhausted. It’s packing small, so it’s super easy to fit it in the external pockets of a backpack, so you don’t waste any unnecessary time- game changer when you are in the winter mountain. The pockets are awesome and the jacket is super comfortable. I was worried about the Velcro on the cuffs, since a lot of jackets will loosen  and let air in between the cuff and your gloves, but the Velcro works super well and gives you a solid locked-in feeling. Last but not least, it beats off strong winds like it’s nothing. This feature helps you dress lighter, move faster, and get tired less. This jacket improved my performance per unit of effort in the mountain, which is essential since most mistakes happen out of exhaustion. Really happy about my purchase!
review.name: Irreplaceable in Winter Conditions

review.reviewBody: The single best jacket I've ever owned. The fabric is simply a slam dunk and the technical design is on point. Enough room for movement and the sleeves are long enough to use it on a bike aswell. I would like to see a jacket with the cut and features of the  Skogso Jacket in the Eco-Shell fabric. I would then have a jacket to wear all year, anywhere.
review.name: Superb Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I was tired of always getting completely soaked every time I went out in the rain. I had been in the market for a high quality shell and something that was not Gore-Tex (as it is terrible for the environment). I knew that Fjallraven made high quality outdoor gear that was environmentally friendly and sustainable. So I purchased this and have not been disappointed. I have been out in some miserable weather and have had stayed completely dry. 

My only gripe is the adjusters that cinch the hood down - I have a long neck and sometimes they do not stay in place if you are moving around a lot.
review.name: Best Shell I have ever purchased

review.reviewBody:
Love it. It totally fits me.  
The quality is awesome. 
It is my first shell jacket.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody:
Have this jacket for a year now,i use it for wild camping when i stay severay days outdoora without any contact of civilization.
I use it as part of my kit that will keep the wind out ,keep me warm without bulking and if i manage to get caught in rain it will keep me dry,it did all these things.
However,jacket is not for prolonged rain since outer fabrix is soft and cant apply dwr properly like on other shell jackets,it gets extremly wey on outside that it gets you feeling cold even with some layers underneath.
Front pockets are not waterproof since they dont have taped seams inside and water gets in easily.
Overall i bought it at 50% of the retail price and im extremly happy,jacket is comfortable,stretcy,tough and fits great just has some flaws to it and its not perfect.
review.name: Great piece of kit

review.reviewBody: Great product, had it for almost 5 years now. Its just starting to take in a bit of water. I've re-applied waterproofing a few times throughout the years, and use this ~30 times a year skiing in the Rockies. I will probably replace it, but overall a great jacket that I was very impressed with.
review.name: Solid jacket for the mountains

review.reviewBody: I too had trouble with the water getting right thru. Even from brand new this doesn't really have a DWR layer, it just absorbs, but you notice after anything more then light rain that it soaks thru eventually. Also to echo some here, the chest pockets become full of water in heavy rain, they're not waterproof, its silly. Perhaps they need to use Gore-tex if they can't create their own waterproof fabrics.
review.name: Need to go back to the drawing board.

review.reviewBody: This is the best shell jacket I have ever owned! On a recent trip to Paris, I wore it for 7 straight days, and experienced high winds and rain every day. The jacket kept me warm, it is thoroughly water resistant and I felt ´dry’ inside, with my Keb hoodie. Furthermore the jacket is ´quiet’ and I like the pocket location and ventilation options. Would buy again in a heartbeat. It’s an investment!
review.name: Excellent Shell Jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket was excellent with one massive dealbreaking flaw. The protection it offers is excellent and I love the upper utility pockets. However, the fact that it lacks handwarmer pockets is a dealbreaker. I returned my jacket for this reason. I would buy it again in a heartbeat if a new model came out with handwarmer pockets. It is a massive disappointment that Fjallraven only offers 2 durable eco-shell jackets, and neither has usable hand pockets
review.name: Dealbreaking flaw

review.reviewBody: I like the style of this jacket. I can open and close with my winter glove but sometimes a little harder. I wish they have more color option before I bought it.
review.name: Great eco shell and color

name: Keb Eco-Shell Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bungee is awesome. It will adjust to whatever size you need. Purchased M and L in these hats. We have blue and yellow. Large brim. I haven't tested if the hat floats but I assume it would for a little bit. The chin strap has a safety feature clip. For kids and camp or daycare this is a must summer item.
review.name: Waterproof and Sun protective ☀️ fabric

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) bought for my two year old, fits him great and provides a good amount of shade while also keeping him cool due to the lightweight material. He gets lots of complements from people on hikes.
review.name: toddler approved sun hat

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Love this hat! It's super cute on my little guy and it provides the perfect amount of coverage. I don't have to worry at all about his face burning. I'll be purchasing another as soon as he outgrows this one.
review.name: Excellent Coverage

review.reviewBody: I have a very picky child with sensory processing issues and we tried several hats with no luck until I brought this one. She loves it and it handles pool and lake swimming well. It's been though several camping trips and it looks brand new.
review.name: My daughter loves this sun hat!

review.reviewBody: My kid loves the hat. It's gone with him everywhere the sun has been - ocean, swimming pools, lakes, and the water parks, too. Holds up well, and my fussy kid asks for this hat over his other choices
review.name: Great hat - keeps my boy cool

review.reviewBody: I love these Rambler hats for the kids. The brim on the kids small/medium is perfect and not too large. When you go to the kids large, the brim size is the same as an adults and it gets in the way. Suggestion to keep the brim size same for all kids sizes. Otherwise, this is a 10* in my booksto large is the sam
review.name: Excellent product - only a size issue is the reason for 4*

review.reviewBody: I have one I wear on our boat and our daughter wanted one as well and she loves it! She was sad we couldn't get the same color but it turned out to be fine!
review.name: Love this hat

review.reviewBody: The Medium fits 2.5 year old and he loves it. Never takes it off
review.name: I bought another for the 1.5 year old

review.reviewBody: I purchaser 2 of these for my 7 and 9 year olds. They both like wear them and actually think they are cool. I was worried they would not want to give up there ball caps but I haven't heard any arguments.
review.name: Great for kids!

review.reviewBody: This hat is perfect for adventure outdoors with little ones. My 8 year old gladly wears it along with my 3 year old. Beach days, hiking or playing outside it's worked well to give great sun protection.

description: Buy the Merrell Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Merrell Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: We’ve bought these exact shoes 3 times and he always picks these over his other shoes from October until May in New England. It’s nice that his feet will stay dry and I don’t have to send him to school in rain boots that he will have to clomp around in all day. They hold up until he grows out of them.
review.name: I buy them every year.
comment: Thank you for sharing the great experience!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: My daughters love them, water proof is a big plus. Adventures in Costa Rica were so easy for them. Our family loves Merell.
review.name: Ultimate kids shoes

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Great quality and very comfortable for my daughter. She wore them to camp for the whole time. And they look good!
review.name: Great quality - excellent shoe for kids

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Replacement of an older worn out pair. Use as everyday footwear.
review.name: Great shoe.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: This is one of the best and comfortable shoes I have ever worn. I always wanted to get Merrell for a long time and I was so glad I could find these. I specifically purchased for our trip which comprised lot of walking (airports,cities etc), glacier hike (with crampons) and in the beach and with good waterproofing too. No pain in the feet and was so comfortable all along for almost 10+ hrs each day.
review.name: Comfortable Hiking shoes ever!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I purchased these waterproof hiking sneakers for my son. They are definitely well made, however, his only complete was that the shoe itself was too heavy. I do wish they came in more colors.
review.name: Too heavy

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: loved the ankle version, bought second pair, coz I could, comfy like a pair of slippers. No breaking in, just put them on and go go go on your adventure
review.name: comfy as a pair of slippers

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: These were the perfect, waterproof hiking shoe for our young son during our recent, Alaskan cruise where we had a handful of excursions like whale watching, glacier viewing, lumber jack show and short hikes.
review.name: Awesome shoe for Alaska trip!
comment: We love this! Thanks for sharing your journey with us!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Very heavy but the wide size fit our son's tall feet that won't fit in non-wide shoes. Seem to be waterproof. The shoelaces stay tied when double knotted. They seem like they would stay tied if just regularly tied, but we haven't tried yet. They are durable and may last  a long time. Our last pair were hand-me-downs and still look new even though our son wore them for many months. Sizing was typical sizing.
review.name: Durable, thankful for wide!
comment: Thank you for the awesome review!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I love these do much I’m ordering the black ones!!
comment: Your review has us smiling wide!

name: Moab 3 Low Lace Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Kids'

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really great jacket ! Size is a bit big for me but I’ll change it for the S size. Beautiful jacket !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the jacket. I’m 5’10 185 pounds and built like an absolutely unit and it fits loose and well. It looks a little weird without the hood but 10/10 would buy it again.
review.name: Sweet jacket

review.reviewBody: Got the white/tobacco color way which looks sick. Personally, the removable hood, elastic cuffs, and internal pockets are my favorite features. I’m 5’10 185lbs, athletic build. I prefer a “normal” fit over baggy and the medium fits perfectly.

review.reviewBody: It’s a loose fit jacket I sized into L and like the baggy look.
review.name: It’s a loose fit jacket

review.reviewBody: Super stylish jacket! I got the tye dye color way and the colors seem a bit darker in person, but it’s still awesome. I think the jacket fits true to size, but was a bit more snug than I expected. I would say order true to size if you want a more snug fit, and a size up if you want the baggier look and feel!
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So many details 
Including the pocket for phone and little loops for wired headphones to loop through 

The vented sleeves as well as the inner print on the jacket is just such a happy vibe 

Really stoked to get out on hill 

Nevermind the amazing cinch cuffed wrist oooooooo
review.name: Jacket 2024

review.reviewBody: This jacket is dope, comfy and perfectly baggy. Loving the matching jacket and pants

hasVariant.description: Buy the Carve Designs Dylan Gauze Shirt - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this top a few months ago and it has been perfect for the transition weather in Texas.  The top is really comfortable and cute tucked in or untucked.
review.name: Cute and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Love the shirt and material. Other reviewers said to order up a size so I did. I wish I would have gotten my original size, but I still like it. It is more see thru than I had anticipated but I just wear a tank under it.
review.name: Versatile shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the Cloud Taj print, so much that I originally purchased a short sleeve version, but it didn't fit quite right, so I donated it and tried this long sleeve version. The fit is better, but it still puffs out strangely in the upper back area between my shoulder blades, and in the front, the fabric has a habit of continually sliding up and backwards, so that I am constantly pulling it back down to re-adjust the neckline. This happens even when I have the front tucked in.
review.name: Love the pattern, but not in love with the fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the fit and variety of colors of these Dylan gauze shirts. I own at least 6 of them! Always a winner...looks great right out of the washing machine, no iron necessary!
review.name: Love these shirts

review.reviewBody: This is going to be my fav fall shirt to wear with Jeans or with a pencil skirt. The material is so nice and the design is so pretty! I’m going to get in more colors! I wear a 36D and I find it to fit perfect, not tight but not too lose.
review.name: Love this top!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, cool, and warm with sleeves down. Perfect with my jean skirt, jean shorts, and jeans all colors! Easy to wash and wear. So lightweight and flattering. I’ve worn them to work, and play.
review.name: Grapefruit Milos Gauze Shirt

review.reviewBody: Lightweight fabric and easy care. Love the color and I get so many compliments when I wear it
review.name: Lightweight fabric and easy care.

review.reviewBody: Great addition to the spring and fall wardrobes! Looks good with skorts/shorts or under a jacket or vest!
review.name: So pretty

review.reviewBody: Light weight and really cute! Fits nice! Love the airy style!
review.name: Love this shirt!

review.reviewBody: I would buy this shirt in nearly every color if it were still available in my size. I hope they restock!
review.name: Fantastic for Everyday

name: Dylan Gauze Shirt - Women's

Has enough coverage that I'll even rock it with a bra for an indoor spin session. The chamois is great for 4-5 hour rides. One of the best bibs I've ever used. review.itemreviewed: Be My Baby Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this shirt almost 3 or 4 years ago and it’s still riding with me. Free Peoples whole deal is that everything is really supposed to look a bit worn out so the aging only does good for their clothing. It gets thinner the more you wash and wear, of course, but is still such a cute staple in my wardrobe. Fits like a “baby tee”. It’s supposed to be tightfitting and cropped so I’d say it’s true to size.
review.name: Love this shirt

review.itemreviewed: Be My Baby Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is a cute baby tee and is meant to be a smaller fit, hence the name. I got a large as my normal size and love. It is very stretchy and forgiving. If you want a looser fit, you could consider sizing up.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody:
I bought  these two years ago. I have about 6 pairs of hiking pants , all from different designers. These are by far my favourite. I have probably worn them on about 8 mountain hikes. there is an area where there is the softer stretchy fabric that is pilling (showing wear) . I just hope it doesnt get worse. We will see!
Happy Hiking!
review.name: love them, but...

review.reviewBody: Im so disappointed, I bought my second pair in black and the improved fit has not improved or impressed. My first pair which I bought years ago fit me perfectly and I ordered  the same Size 2 , Short just yesterday and they are way to big !! And theres no smaller size to go down to.
review.name: Bummer

review.reviewBody: I was worried that the waist would be too tight on me as I am not used to wearing high-waisted pants and I do not have a curvy figure. Going by the size guide, I ordered size 40, but the hips and legs were much too baggy, although the waist was okay but still loose. I took a chance and exchanged the 40 for a 38. When I first tried them on I found the hips and legs fit perfectly. But the waist, as feared, seemed too snug. I kept the pants for a couple of weeks and every few days I would try them on and wear for short periods indoors. After a while, the waist started to loosen just enough to feel comfortable. I have worn them a few times now and the fit just keeps getting better! I am so happy because I really wanted to like these pants and now I have a pair that fit beautifully. I will use them for hiking year round and in the winter as a good pair of outdoor pants in Alaska.
review.name: If the waist seems a bit snug, keep trying!

review.reviewBody: I love these trousers, they’re my favourite. There are two things I would improve through- I would love to see these with an elasticated waist for better comfort and freedom of movement, also I can’t be the only woman who’s waist size fluctuates throughout the month and even day! The other issue I have is that for some reason the G1000 areas attract pet hair like a magnet. It shows up a lot on my black pair which makes me reluctant to wear them.
review.name: Great but a couple of suggestions

review.reviewBody: My daughter got me a pair of these pants for Christmas last year. When I tried them on I instantly fell in love with how they felt. They were a little big in the waste and slightly long. However, what I really love about these pants are the ankle straps and the ability to cinch them around your boots. Perfect hunting pant in my opinion with leg/thigh vents and large pockets fir phone and e-collar remote, or anything you carry. They are super comfortable, water resistant on the legs,  and they dry quickly everywhere. I love them so much that I'm ordering my 3rd pair (my second pair I ordered a size smaller sz.4, and they fit perfectly) and a pair for my son in law and husband for Christmas. For reference, I'm 5'2 135# with Athletic build.
review.name: Excellent fit and wear!

review.reviewBody: I purchased my first pair of Keb trousers two years ago. I love them so much I recently purchased a second pair in the same size (38). The new pair are the updated, “improved fit” style. The new pair are way too large and baggy in the seat and legs. It is hard to believe they are the same size! I am going to try going down to a 36, but I doubt the size 36 waist will fit me! So sorry they changed the fit. Everything else about the trousers looks as great as in the original fit.
review.name: “Improved Fit” is no improvement!!

review.reviewBody: 5 stars!  My favorite pants.  In the old version (pre-2023) I wore a size 38 Reg, and the hung lower on my waist, in the new revised version I wear a size 36 Reg and they are a bit higher waisted.  I prefer the newer version as it fits my waist better.  I’m 5’6, 125lbs, 36” hip, 28” waist.
review.name: Excellent hiking pants - love the new version

review.reviewBody: So so sad that sizing has been changed. I used to love these pants. All the new sizes are too large. These were my go-to for work pants too :(
review.name: No More Fjallraven for me!

review.reviewBody: I have purchased several pairs of Kebs in different sizes as I have changed shape and weight over the years. They are fabulous trousers and I love them. My most recent is an October 2021 pair, size 46, that fits perfectly. I needed another, additional pair for a trip to Northern Norway in a few weeks. The website announces the "improved fit" and suggests that size 46 might consider sizing down. I did, and ordered a 44. It is too tight and a bit short. I then ordered the 46, and to my surprise and disappointment it looks fat and sloppy on me. The "old fit" was perfect; neither of the "improved fit" sizes, fits. I am struggling to decide on a distinct second best from my old ones, and it's an expensive decision. Not a happy camper here.
review.name: "Improved fit": not in my case

review.reviewBody:
I bought these pants two weeks ago and I have used them a few times and I'm OBSESSED.  One day, I wore them on a 22-mile day hike that involved moving through brush and climbing.  There were a few cacti that I didn't notice, and these pants saved me from being stabbed by them!  They also stayed comfortable and didn't stretch at all throughout the day.

I also got poured on one of my other hikes and these pants stayed dry.  

Worth the price if you hike a lot!
review.name: amazing pants

name: Keb Trouser - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet as an upgrade from my old Specialized helmet before MIPS had become known.  The helmet is exactly what I ordered and compared to list price, Backcountry had a great deal on the product I wanted.  I have ridden with this helmet probably close to 150 miles now and have crashed plenty of times. :-(  Fortunately no skull crushers but the helmet has kept me confident and safe.  This model lacks good ventilation IMO but that seems to be how these companies get you.  You gotta buy the most expensive model to get the better airflow.  The harness tightens up easy and the fit is good.  Once it is on and tight it stays in place and rides well.
review.name: Great helmet for a great price

review.reviewBody: Fit great, plenty of adjustment for much larger head than mine (23 1/4") yet the I had the chin strap adjusted all the way out and if I leaned my head down a bit, like I might riding a bike, was too short and choked me.  Other than that really liked and would have kept.
review.name: Chin strap too short

name: Mainframe Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: It has very good grip on the walls and I could edge very well with it
review.name: Most comfortable climbing shoe I’ve ever worn

review.reviewBody: A great shoe for beginners and overall great quality has good grip and a slight hook in the front to help you with more intermediate climbs
review.name: Great purchase for a beginner shoes, has good grip

review.reviewBody: Beginner here, went a half-size up and it was the right decision. Once they break in they will fit perfect. Great comfort... could almost keep em on my whole session
review.name: Good climbing shoe

review.reviewBody: Been wearing these for about a month, great quality. My first pair of climbing shoes, functional and stylish.
review.name: Great first time climbing shoe

review.reviewBody: Good shoes good value. 5:10 are great climbing shoes would recommend.
review.name: As with all climbing shoes, they are a tight fit

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable. Most of my friends have to take off their shoes to climb but i can wear mine for 6 hours at a time before i need a break.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: Great climbing shoe to start off with. Fits well and grabs well.
review.name: Fits great.

review.reviewBody: Really good quality, comfortable and robust when climbing
review.name: Slightly tight but that’s what you need

review.reviewBody: Comfortable shoes, seem to run a bit larger than other climbing shoe brands. Closer to my street shoe size instead of being much smaller.
review.name: Great shoes beginner shoes.

review.reviewBody: I bought size 9, my regular shoe size is 8.5+. Kirigami is very comfortable, but it will quickly stretch at least 0.5 size. I should have bought my regular shoe size and suffer the first couple of hours. The rubber wears down very fast. I climbed indoors for less than 100 hours, and part of the sole under the big toe is completely worn out on both shoes. I owned the older version of this shoe, Five Ten Coyote VCS, and it lasted much longer.
review.name: Comfortable but wears down fast.

name: Kirigami Climbing Shoe

description: Buy the MSR Windburner Ceramic Skillet online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Windburner Ceramic Skillet
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Windburner Ceramic Skillet online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I like it, it works very well. I'd like to have one smaller for one person.
review.name: Smaller size

review.reviewBody: This is nice, fine to cook with. However, an option to have a lid that is made for it would make some cooking instances better. There is no lid option.
review.name: No Lid Available

review.reviewBody: Works well. Heats up fast but heat is not uniform in the pan but centred. Coating is holding up well. Would definitely recommend it.
review.name: Good skillet

review.reviewBody: Poor quality of the material. It is not non-stick and the enamel peels off after a short time of use. Temperature only in the center, not at the edges. For its price, disappointing.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody: Excellent, well-made products! Easy to use, easy to clean! Highly recommend!
review.name: Excellent, well-made products! Easy to

review.reviewBody: I wish I had read the other reviews. Similar experience. 1) It heats pretty much only the center 2) there's no efficiency gain as there is with the pots, as it lacks the heat-distributing ""vanes"" that the pots have. I bought this as I thought it might do a better job of pancakes than the regular camping set pan plus modified Jetboil pot stand that I had been using. Instead it's far WORSE as you cannot move the pan over the flame to distribute the heat, even. With a little effort, MSR could have added the ""magic vanes"" that make the pots so good. And for this price, I'd expect ""a little effort"". Pictures show the disaster it made of pancakes, compared to the great job (if gas-inefficient) the regular pan managed.
review.name: Heats poorly and unevenly, not very non-stick

review.reviewBody: I have owned this pan since the ceramic model became available, it still looks new to this day. The non coating is good quality, my pan has a scuff from a rough item in bag, but that doesn't effect the non stick, have yet to have anything stick in this pan, cheese even!. The pan makes the stove a fuel sipper, I have no complaints about the pan or msr.
review.name: Another A+ for msr

review.reviewBody: As one of the other person mentioned, the pan is uneven. Liquid/oil runs toward the edges. Heat is not distributed across the entire pan, many times my pan is burned in the center and cold around the outside. Non-stick coating wear off very quick. You can put a lot more oil on and adjust the temp lower, but it's a disappointment considering how great the windburner pot is
review.name: Design could be improve

review.reviewBody: Works great and it is so lightweight. I cooked a steak using this pan while on a backpacking trip and it was perfect! Easily cleaned too. Highly recommended accessory if you have the windburner stove system
review.name: Perfect for backpacking

review.reviewBody: Worked great. Used it to cook eggs and pancakes, heat up burger patties, and make Mac n cheese while backpacking. Sits snugly on my personal windburner Stove.
review.name: Perfect for my trip

name: Windburner Ceramic Skillet

description: Buy the Camp Chef Pursuit Patio Cover online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pursuit Patio Cover
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Pursuit Patio Cover online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Cover looks great however it dries out after one year and rips very easily. We have sowed and patched the rips but they continue to happen all over.  Material used is brittle after one year sadly.  At this price point, I expect more than one season.
review.name: Great fit, Looks good, Short lifespan

review.reviewBody: Good cover, but only lasts about 2 years before it starts tearing
review.name: Good cover but only lasts about 2 years

review.reviewBody:
First received was fantastic,after two years falling apart and  material turning to powder ???  But have no choice ,if you want to keep your grill
protected. We also have it stored under roof overhang.
review.name: Highly Expensive Garbage

review.reviewBody:
The cover is good and fits on top of the 36 inch Camp Chef Woodwind Pro with the sidekick (and griddle, pizza over or sear box) However, they call it a snug fit, but realistically it's not designed to fit like a glove.

Once the cover is on, there's no easy way to do the straps as they are too short. Probably designed for a previous model with a chimney and never updated.

You can leave the propane tank on and the cover will still fit, but maybe an opening at the right height could allow you to put the cover on and leave the tank outside.

Overall, the cover does what it's supposed to do and protects the grill but it's not different than a third party cover as it doesn't perfectly fit the grill as it should coming from the manufacturer.
review.name: Good cover, not a perfect fit but it works.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This fits my Woodwin Pro perfectly, The quality of the cover is amazing!
review.name: I covered my meat smoker

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought one a few years ago to cover my new Camp Chef smoker.  Originally I was happy, but after two years I started noticing small tears here and there which was surprising as I had taken good care of it.  Within the last few months it has completely fallen apart and now I’m looking for a new cover.  I’d expect a weather proof cover it last longer than 2-3 years.  My smoker has held up great on the other hand.
review.name: Doesn’t Hold up

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Starts out ok, though a tight fit with a sidekick is a bit annoying. A few years of exposure to the sun/rain and it will shred into pieces like paper. Going to take a gamble and buy a random generic cover instead from another online retailer. Same thing might happen, but at least there is a chance it might be better? And cost is lower.

Certainly not the standard i'd expect here.
review.name: Shreds to pieces after a few years of sun exposure

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The grill cover is the best we have ever had.  It fits well and actually stays on like it should!
review.name: Best cover

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought to replace my aging cover. Looks great and fits perfectly
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] cover looks good, keeps grill clean - covered a woodwind pro 36 just right
review.name: Good cover

name: Pursuit Patio Cover

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Telos TR2 Big Footprint online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Telos TR2 Big Footprint
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Telos TR2 Big Footprint online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nothing fancy. It works well, and the extra footprint room allowing to step on it instead of the ground is very nice.
review.name: Just works

review.reviewBody: Definitely get this, protect your investment, also gives a nice floor under the vestibule so you don't have to deal with shoes, etc in the tent.
review.name: Critical

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is fantastic as it gives a place to crouch or kneel getting in the tent, and helps keeps the dirt from getting in. I'd use the smaller ground cloth when backpacking as the additional weight can be felt, but for car camping it's perfect. It also gives a nice spot from my dog to sleep!
review.name: More covered ground, clean entrance and exits

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works as expected. I like having a footprint that extends into the vestibule.
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: We purchased the footprint/ground cloth to go with our Telos TRS+ tent. The selling point was the shape of the footprint was to match not just the tent area but also be under the 2 vestibules. With other tents I would just supplement a rectangular groundcloth with 2 pieces of fabric to serve as an added dry place under the vestibutle entrances. The challenge though was the shape of the 6 sided footprint. When laying out the footprint which was the top, sides and bottom. After several rotations, noting which is the short side vs long side of the vestibule areas then I'd eventually figure it out. But all very time consuming. So sort of color coding or arrows indicating top/bottom would be helpful. The 2nd challenge is when setting up the tent and putting the poles in the tent receiving holes AND the footprint's rubber grommets that works fine until you want to put the rainfly on. The layering of rubber grommet, tent pole insert into the tent corner hole and then trying to attach the rainfly clip gets to be problematic and difficult. At each corner, to attach the rainfly little "U' clip I had to first detach the tent from the footprint grommet, clip the rainfly onto the tent pole clip and re-insert the tent pole into the footprint rubber grommet. Again, extra time fiddling around. This was a brand new tent with brand new footprint.Yes, we were in rain and snow for 2.5 days but I was very cautious with the ground for the footprint as I was concerned about the durability of the fabric. Unfortunately, being diligent was not enough and a 1 inch tear in the footprint is what we ended our 10 day backcountry trek with. It is always a bit disappointing for gear to come back damaged only after one use. Like automobiles we use our camping gear for many years and expect them to be durable. The footprint is good in concept but be aware that any vestibule dripping due to rain or melting snow onto the footprint may cause the puddling to flow under the tent floor. This was the case after 2.5 days of wet snow. So my past use of a separate small fabric "footprint" under the vestibules worked better as I could pull up that piece of fabric separate from the tent structure and direct any puddles away from the tent.
review.name: Confusing to set up

review.reviewBody: Like this foot print so far. Larger and a little heavier than over but tougher I think for gravel bar camping on ozark rivers.
review.name: Seems well made

name: Telos TR2 Big Footprint

review.reviewBody: I bought these for hiking but they are so cute I don’t want them dirty. Really like the height of the shoe, the ankle support and style. I’m a 9 and they fit snug.

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Mid Outdry Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable with cushioned footbed. And beautiful. As a runner I’ve been spoiled by wanting all my casual shoes to be as comfortable. These non running every day shoes count. Get them, they won’t disappoint. Sizing: normally I wear a 7 medium width and ordered that size. If I was in a store I would have also tried on a 6.5 just in case as the pair I ordered is on the verge of feeling big. But after adjusting the laces I decided to keep them. No sloshy experience, so if in doubt order your true size.
review.name: Beautiful and super comfy

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Mid Outdry Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Only had a couple of days to wear around the house before a hiking trip to Arizona. I have a slightly wide foot and these fit perfectly even with wool socks and without sizing up. We pack light on flights so had to wear these 90% of the time on our 5 day trip and they were impressively comfortable throughout. I even got a compliment in the airport on how stylish they are. Went on 4 hikes of 2+ hours over somewhat rocky terrain with no soreness whatsoever; excellent traction both on smooth boulders and loose, sandy soil. Have also performed well back home in Wisconsin on wet, slippery leaves/mud. Have only been in use for a few months so can't comment on longevity, but would purchase again without hesitation.
review.name: Comfortable out of the box!

review.itemreviewed: Facet 75 Mid Outdry Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Just got these and I haven't had a chance to break them in yet, but based on first impressions I'm very happy with this purchase. I got the sage color and I think they look even better in person. These are SO lightweight I wasn't even prepared for that. They are very comfortable on the feet and have enough width to accommodate my wide feet. I'm excited to get to use them. I'm not an avid hiker, but I'm looking to walk more outdoors and these seem like they'll be perfect for that.
review.name: Great shoes

hasVariant.name: Kinetic RNEGD Caribou Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the SOREL Kinetic RNEGD Caribou Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The boots are cute and warm, but they run big. I ordered a 5 1/2 and the were a bit snug so sent them back for a size 6. The 6 is too big.
review.name: Size Questionable
comment: Hello Wittvj, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Kinetic™ RNEGD Caribou Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: These are perfect ! I wanted a pair of  boots for walking my dog every day. They needed to be comfortable waterproof have good non slip soles and not wear down after one season. These boots ticked all the boxes. The one small suggestion I have is the bottom of the boot being white is a pain as it’s always dirty !
review.name: Perfect walking boot

review.reviewBody: These boots have a little extra length in the heel which helps stabilize you when walking, and gives you extra contact with the ground when it’s slick.
review.name: Very warm, great for walking in snow and ice.

review.reviewBody: Very comfy and cute. Color is subtle but pretty. Good arch support. Felt tight at first but quickly molded to my feet.
review.name: Very versatile shoe!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a comfortable AND warm boot in the winter to go on walks and hit the jackpot with these boots. They're ridiculously comfortable and really really keep you feet warm without getting sweaty. The support is great and they're cute to boot (pun intended) so that's a plus. If you're looking for good shoes for winter walks with the dogs/kids/whomever, look no further!
review.name: Love my "Winter Walkers"

review.reviewBody: I can't wear these they are too tight in the front.
review.name: So Disappointed...
comment: Hello Suzy, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Kinetic™ RNEGD Caribou Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I love love love these sneaker boots. They are warm and comfortable. At the beginning the widest front part of my left foot felt a bit crunched, but this went away after some time wearing them. I was unaware that my feet were different widths, so maybe its a product error or maybe my feet actually are, lol. Overall the quality is great and they provide such good support. I mainly wear them running errands in the winter in upstate new york. They are really nice material on the top though, so I don't plan to wear them in the mud or snow because I don't want them to get damaged.
review.name: Really nice sneaker boots

review.reviewBody: Run small so size up!! Quality is great however I can’t tell if they are super uncomfy and a little hard to walk in bc of running small or if it would be better if I sized way up.
review.name: Size Up
comment: Hello Taylor, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Kinetic™ RNEGD Caribou Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Size up .5 for the perfect fit, very comfortable shoe
review.name: Great sneaker/ boot hybrid

review.reviewBody: Nice and comfortable. Keep my feet warm and dry during cold weather. Run small, so 1/2 size up.
review.name: Comfy

hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Wasatch Ripstop Trail Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought for backpacking but so far have only worn around town.  I love all the various pockets, fabric is very comfortable, fit is loose but I prefer that.  I'm 5'4", 100 pounds, ordered a size 2 reg. Length perfect.
review.name: Great pants at bargain price

review.reviewBody: I was very excited about these pants but they were too small for me and the bigger size was out of stock.
review.name: Run small

review.reviewBody:
I have a very niche job where we have to be running around outside a lot, yet look professional (lol). These pants are literally the PERFECT combination for my needs. I'm so extremely pleased with this purchase, they fit perfectly, the pockets are actual real pockets that can hold your whole phone (women, if you know, you know).
I'd recommend these to anyone!
review.name: Favorite work pants

review.reviewBody: Comfy. Love the waist. Love the color
review.name: Great hiking pant

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants in black because I photograph elopements in nature and I wanted a pant that can hold up to all the hiking and climbing I do in nature, while looking professional. They have done that and more! They look great and feel so comfortable.
review.name: So comfortable and rugged!

review.reviewBody: I got them in black and I wear these pants ALL the time! The only pants I can wear backpacking and in the office. One of my best decisions!
review.name: So good!

review.reviewBody: I hike the Half Dome in these pants and wouldn't have wanted it any other way. They stayed on around my waist, were comfortable, and actually fit my larger thighs. The pants had a good amount of movement. They were breathable and dried quickly when wet.
review.name: A Pant that actually stays up

review.reviewBody: These handy, attractive, pants are great-fitting and I liked them enough to buy 3 pairs. Fabric is smooth, fairly stretchy, breathable, and light but not flimsy. I needed them to stand up to outdoorsy lifestyle and dog training activities but still look fine running errands in town. They're almost perfect. Add top stitching to front pockets to maintain a tailored look and a crotch gusset for extra mobility and they'd be perfect...But that would put them beyond their current great price. Perfect length for 5'5"
review.name: Great multi-purpose pants, great price!

review.reviewBody: These pants are a little loose, but I love the ability to wear compression tights beneath them and not feel overly constricted. They breathe well and feel very light. They aren't as heavy-duty my other ripstop pants, so I'm not sure how much twig snagging and butt sliding in the Adirondacks they will tolerate compared to the pants I'm used to - but I'm willing to find out. If these last, I'll order more. I'm 135 pounds, 5'5", and I ordered a size 4. A size 2 may have been okay, but I'll stay with 4 for the layering and comfort.
review.name: My favorite pants

review.reviewBody: Wasatch ripstop pants in size 12.  I am 5'8", 150 pounds.  Pants a bit baggy but comfortable & lightweight for hot weather. The 29.5 inseam is just barely long enough for me; wish this came in longer inseam sizes.  Comfortable waistband, and the belt loops are wide enough to fit an actual belt!  Larger pockets would be nice; the thigh pocket is disappointingly small.
review.name: Lightweight & comfortable

name: Wasatch Ripstop Trail Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Roswheel Tour 5L Handlebar Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tour 5L Handlebar Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Roswheel Tour 5L Handlebar Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This bag looks great and the idea of a clamp rather than velcro straps made this bag appealing.  The bag itself seems very well made and is of sturdy construction. The clamp however, does not play well with brake and shifter cables.  The clamp itself is too small for the thickness of the bars so attaching it leaves a lengthy portion of the screws exposed.  I could not attach the clamp as intended unless I removed my bar tape and repositioned my cables.
The bag is a waterproof, roll-top bag, but the clasps are a weird cinch strap.  This would probably be fine if you wanted to stop every time you access your bag, but it would be awkward and likely unsafe to attempt to use the bag while in motion.
Disappointed and had to be returned.
review.name: Looks great, but poor design

name: Tour 5L Handlebar Bag

review.reviewBody: Super soft, quality excellent, very well constructed - can tell it will last a long while - fit/style is very nice as it covers my ears and isn't too tall on my head but it does have a little room on top. I have approx 22inch/56cm measurement around my head and this beanie was quite tight. I wore it for even just a little bit and it was giving me the feeling I was gonna get a headache. Pulling on my hair. SO sadly I returned. Looks like it's selling good, so others have found it not too tight.
