review.reviewBody: Looks Good Shoe size fits. The soul is rugged and grippy on slippery muddy Banks uncomfortable fit around the ankle. Not sure if it’s the hardware on the outside that creates a uncomfortable feeling on your ankles. Might try a different design for more comfortable fit around the ankles. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated
review.name: Uncomfortable fit around the ankle area. But other than that, a great rugged waiter boot.

review.reviewBody:
So far, so good! 
Love the fit and rugged construction. They feel light too.  Lots of stability when walking on boulders, specialy when used with star Cleats.
review.name: Comfortable, sturdy and Light!

review.reviewBody: I prefer the fit of the old style G3 guide boot, however these boots have been great so far

After first time use. The most comfortable boot I 
have ever worn. With the Hardbite studs and star cleats they were very grippy. Now for the test of time 
Terry
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: Solid boot, great traction. Have only used a few times so far but love em. Little tight in the ankle but I’m sure they just need to be broken in.
review.name: Solid Wading Boot

review.reviewBody: Needed to reorder to get right size but all now fits well…won’t be on the river until April so can’t comment yet on performance
Love these new boots very comfortable and supportive.

True to size but wide in the toe box??????...I bought the new g3???s to replace my older style G3???s.   After hiking miles up and down a river here in Colorado, I have a couple observations.  
1. The old style are more molded to your feet and feel like an extension of you.  The new G3???s feel more flat footed and feet tend to slide around a little while hiking these mountains in Colorado; but they do have more room in the toes so they stay warmer.  The new Goodyear welt soles are FAR more rugged and will Fix the primary issue I had with the old G3???s. The old ones had glued on soles and rubber around the side that will start to peel and separate from the boot after years of abuse.
The new ones are comfortable but feel heavier.  They have excellent traction in the water and the wider soles do give more stability and traction while wading. Overall I have high hopes for these boots once they break in.  I love the durability and room in the toes.  I love the traction in the water.
review.name: Rugged New Design!

name: G3 Guide Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have purchased multiple pairs of Speedcross and have  a pair of 6. I was going to hike this morning and the lace broke. Fortunately I had my back up Speedcross 5 that I wore. I remembered why I needed new ones. Concerned about the laces- would be problematic if they broke during a hike.
review.name: Need replacing too soon

review.reviewBody: I used a pair on a two week hiking trip in New Zealand and they were perfect. The nubby treads gave me the extra grip on muddy areas and the lightweight design meant I didn’t feel like I was wearing combat boots. Just bought a new pair for my next adventure.
review.name: Best hiking shoes ever!

review.reviewBody: I stopped liking Speedcross shoes because in Colorado where I live, the soles did not last on our sandy, rocky trails. These new Speedcross seem to have soles of a different material that seems tougher and longer lasting. We shall see how long they last. I like to fit and the way they look! Color is fun! They seem to run a bit large, evn though this is the size I always get.
review.name: Speedcross fan for the past several years

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of Speedcross and probably tenth pair of Salomon's. I wouldn't walk/run/hike in anything else. They are so supportive and comfortable!
review.name: My Speedcross 6s

review.reviewBody: Lightweight comfortable and lots of support!  Love these shoes
review.name: My favorite shoe

review.reviewBody: super comfortable. true to size. even though they are wide, they are still a  bit narrow for my foot, so i can't lace them too tight. perfect for the gym
review.name: very comfortable.

review.reviewBody: This is my 6th pair of Speedcross! Need I say more!!?
review.name: Perfect Shoe!

review.reviewBody: I began running Spartan races about 5 years ago and participate in roughly 5-6 year. Salomon has proven to be the best trail running shoes I have tried. I have bunions and a long middle toe and I can run in these w no pain
review.name: My 5th pair

review.reviewBody: I recommend them 100%! I wasn’t sure if they were going to be comfortable or not and definitely recommend . Super comfy.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I have a low volume foot and many times even Salomon’s are too roomy in the midfoot.  Not these. Plenty of healthy-toe  room in the toe box. I remove the plastic lacing . Good for steep rocky and rooty  downhills.
review.name: Great Close fit

review.reviewBody: I decided to try these shorts because thankfully Giordana offers this option of "shorter shorts". I was a little hesitant to spend this much, but got pleasantly surprised by the quality of the product and the chammy! Very comfortable for long rides and very well made, Giordana shorts will be my go to from now on. They fit small so make sure to order one or two sizes up. I normally wear Medium, but ordered an XL and they fit perfectly.
review.name: Fantastic pair of shorts!

review.reviewBody: As the stylistic trend these days is to make the  inseam longer than ever,  these are shorter inseam like they used to be, say, 5 or more years ago.  This is important for those of us who are shorter in height.   However, the chamois seems bulky between my legs.   It feels like the chamois is trying to force my legs apart, and I must compress the material to stand naturally.   My perception is that  the chamois generally gets thicker as the shorts goes up toward the "pro" level, and this is no exception.   This is OK for the sit-bones, but not further forward.   Pearl Izumi's "Elite" level chamois is less bulky in this region and I recently tried Castelli Endurance 3 and it is even less bulky (but it's inseam was unacceptably long). Seems like more companies should size the chamois along with the garment size, but very few do this today.
review.name: Bulky Chamois for smaller men

review.reviewBody: I bought these specifically to ride indoors, no need for more leg coverage in a basement.  The first ride the pad seemed a touch bulkier than the Castelli's I normally wear, but after a couple washes felt better. On the whole a really good pair of shorts for my indoor rides, appreciate not as much material there to hold the sweat in.
review.name: Great for indoor biking

review.reviewBody:
I?m kind of a short guy (5?6?) and thanks to the pandemic, I?ve been riding a bit more than usual lately (mostly extended sessions on Zwift).  

Thanks to all my extra indoor time and lack of anything better to worry myself about, I recently noticed how much I hate shorts that hit me at just the wrong spot behind the knee.  While in this state of mind, I noticed these on Backcountry/Competitive Cyclist. I already have a way too large collection of Pearl Izumi, Castelli, and Louis Garneau shorts but thought I?d give these a try. 

These shorts hit me just above the knee and feel great.  The pad is a little thick but not so much that it bugs me.  All of this translates to my new favorite shorts.  

If you?re a short person who hates the fit of longer (standard length) shorts, you might find these the perfect length.  I?m happy to say I just bought my third pair with hopes of adding another couple of pairs in the future (but not all at once because they?re kind of pricey!).

Background on me: I?ve been riding road bikes for ~35 years.  Previously strictly road miles, crits, and centuries with friends.  Now (thanks to work and kids), I ride mostly indoors using a Wahoo Kickr on Zwift either  pre-dawn or post-kid bedtimes.  I?m also a gear junky who values quality over quantity when buying new gear.
review.name: Good fit for short guys

review.reviewBody:
I have not ridden in these shorts, so this review is limited to size/fit only:
The size small is a little tight compared to others, so if you are on the edge of the size chart, order a size up. I'll still call it "true to size" but be aware.    The chamois on these seem substantial ( as expected) at the "sit bones" but are very bulky between the legs.   Just standing up the chamois is compressing and trying to spread my legs apart.  It is almost like they are using the size Large chamois in a size small garment.  At this price point,  I'm particular and don't want this much bulkiness.   I have tried Castelli Endurance  and PEARL iZUMi Escape that are similar at the sit bones but are not so bulky further forward between the legs.
review.name: Chamois seems bulky for size small

name: FR-C Pro 5cm Shorter Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
By looking at the sizing chart I thought that medium might run large on me, but I took a chance and ordered it, so I was shocked to find out that I could barely zip it up and it's super tight around my shoulders!! This is terrible information that you guys are giving!! People rely on those measurements when placing orders, so it's very important that they are right. Nobody wants to waste time and effort having to send back an item that should have been right in the first place! When I look at the measurements for the size up (L), they sound like it's going to be too big...
Yes, the material is nice as I expected, but I don't know what to do with this jersey!
review.name: Sizing DOES NOT correspond to size chart

review.reviewBody: This jersey has the functions and feel that I wanted but the size was really off. I normally wear a Pearl Izumi size small, but this small would only fit a child’s girth. It was long enough and had adequate sleeve room, but even though I am skinny, I could not zip it up.  Since it fit length-wise, and the sleeves fit fine, I did not try to replace it with a size medium. Unfortunately I had to pay to return something that was a second or just not up to Pearl fit standards.
review.name: Too tight!

name: Pro Mesh Jersey - Women's

review.reviewBody: Just before I bought this shoe, I had plantar fasciitis, and was looking at a shoe that would have a lot of cushion. I tried the shoe at a store and decided to buy it and take it on the trip. To my surprise, my pain disappeared. I walked for miles, and had no issues at all. The only issue was walking through Dusty Rhodes. All the little orifices on the sides of the shoe were covered in Dust and got cleaned only after I washed the shoe. I usually wear a size 6, but was advised to buy a 6.5 and this worked very well.
review.name: Excellent cushion

review.name: gary haines review

review.reviewBody: I am using the PLB40 to keep our dometic  CFX 35 cold when we are not driving. I keep it connected to our plug in the bed of our truck and the CFX35 so that when we are driving I can charge the PLB 40 and then when we stop the PLB 40 takes over. Works like a champ!
review.name: A MUST have for travel!

review.reviewBody:
A few things after a several 1,300 mile road trips:

My setup looks like this in my 4Runner:   
- Secondary Battery - Always hot 12V outlet in back, connected to the PLB40, connected to a CFX3-45.  This way, the cooler would always be on until I run out of battery (which would be a remote possibility). I hope that makes sense.  

- One trip 1, the problem is that it all worked intermittently and I troubleshooted every single combination down to cords, fuses, my own 4Runner connections, AC/DC, etc.   I'm pretty sure that I diagnosed it down to a faulty cord (the one with the Anderson Connector.  It's a little disconcerting if you can't trust your systems.  

-HERE'S THE GREAT NEWS:  I sent a note note into Dometic Support, told them I needed a new cord.  Three days later I had a whole new PLB40 unit.  Hooked everything up, took another trip and it all worked as planned.  The CFX functioned continuously for a week.  Minimal driving during the day, everything worked!!!

Thank you Dometic, for great Customer Support!!!!
review.name: Initial Review

comment:
Dear Consumer,
Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry to hear about your experience. This is not supposed to happen, please reach out to claim warranty to your dealer you bought the product from or use this link if bought online:  https://www.dometic.com/en-us/support/warranty
We will check what happened wrong and get back to you with a solution or a refund.
It’s always possible to get in contact with our local service providers here: https://www.dometic.com/en-us/support/service-locator
They have a wide expertise and knowledge about our products as well.
Kind regards,
Eszter
Dometic Sales Support

review.reviewBody: I have 2 of these and frig freezer  because we travel on the motorcycle pulling a trailer sometimes 2 weeks at a time or longer. They carry well and charge well.
review.name: For the frig

review.reviewBody: I love the size and efficiency of this battery. Dometic please upgrade it with the same size and dimensions with a little more features!
review.name: Best Battery for your Fridge!

review.reviewBody: I have had the PLB40 for years now and although it has been fairly reliable, it has its flaws, or at least mine does. My biggest complaint is that my screen has always had issues. As soon as I plug it in to charge, the screen slowly disappears. If it ever gets warm at all it seems that’s when the problems happen. And not even extreme, even just mildly warm. I also can’t stand the alarm that won’t stop once the sun goes down and the battery is no longer taking on charge from my solar panel anymore. I wish that was a feature that could be shut off. I wish it would just stop charging and then pick back up when the sun comes up.  I do with it had a 120v outlet so I didn’t have to plug an inverter into it for the times I need to plug in a 120v. Mine flashed the battery symbol at random times, last time it happened, it was charged to 100%So yeah, overall, I have been happy. The little bugs just make me nervous while using it because I have absolutely no clue if it’s charging and what the battery percentage is at.
review.name: Overall I’m happy, but the PLB40 needs refinement.
comment:

If you have purchased your battery through a dealer or reseller, please reach out to them and inquire about their warranty-policy. 

We wish you many more adventures with the PLB40. 

Kind regards, 
Zsófia

review.reviewBody: I recently bought this for my November camping trip. This lantern was a great addition to my gear. It was more than adequate for brightness, on the short daylight days. review.reviewBody: Unacceptable battery performance. Less than 2 hours in High. 3.5 hours in Medium.
review.name: Poor battery performance. New

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of heated gloves from OR. My first pair work so well, I needed something a bit lighter. The Sureshot checks that box. Perfect for light to very cold weather (for Wisco that's at and below freezing), for all sorts of use and applications such as casual wear or skiing
review.name: Perfect for people who get cold hands

review.reviewBody: I ordered the gloves, using my standard glove size, and they are wa too small.
review.name: Sizing Way Off

review.reviewBody: won't heat for longer than 45 mins on LOW. PLUS they are not warm all over the gloves.
review.name: Bad batteries or bad gloves

review.reviewBody: Typically OR gear fits true to size and fits me well. I own various gloves and mittens in size XL and they all fit great. Likewise with OR clothing. However, these particular gloves fit VERY tight. They are NOT XL in size. In addition to being tight everywhere, the fingers are super short. So for a really expensive pair of gloves, I haven't been able to wear them and can't comment on their long term heating ability in the field.
review.name: Beware of Sizing, Run Very Small!

review.reviewBody: These gloves are quite effective for casual strolls in town or social gatherings with friends. However, they fall short under extreme conditions and are not waterproof, so additional waterproof layers would be advisable. Another point of contention is their sizing chart. I found the large size too restrictive in the thumb area, whereas the XL seemed overly spacious, almost half of an inch around the fingers. The sizes appear to vary significantly. I initially purchased both the large and XL sizes, but eventually returned the XL. On the upside, the gloves do keep your hands warm and largely align with their advertised function, although there is room for improvement in terms of waterproofing and sizing.
review.name: Good glove for casual events only.

review.reviewBody: We actually got these primarily for driving our electric car, since we don;t want to waste car battery power to heat the interior. One tip I learned is to turn them on to high a few minutes before putting them on, and that's when you really notice how warm they are. THe lower settings are too low to warm up cold hands, but great for maintenance so warm hands stay warm. My 2 complaints are that the battery life seems to be quite a bit less than advertised, and the fingers feel really chubby, so they are not as comfortable to wear as we hoped.
review.name: worth having, but tweaks still needed

review.reviewBody: I think these gloves are a bit of a niche offering for someone who is looking for a very specific balance of heat and dexterity. I can definitely see how people would be disappointed with them as they are not super-warm. However, as someone who gets cold hands very easily, they are the only solution I have found so far to being able to do things like operating my camera and drone in winter. I previously tried just about every kind of non-heated glove/mitten you could imagine and none of them worked as I could never get sufficient dexterity in a glove that kept my hands warm enough. These OR gloves keep my hands just warm enough, while I have just enough dexterity to do what I need to do. They may not be the perfect solution, but they are the only solution I have found, so for that I have to give them a good rating. While I bought the gloves specifically for camera work, I have also been enjoying using them for: 1) Cycling to work in winter 2) Snow shoeing (it's good to be able to dial down the heat as you warm up) 3) Driving (since my car is old and takes about 20 minutes to heat up!) 4) Extremely cold weather (in combination with mittens) I would not recommend buying these gloves if you are purely looking for warmth, as I expect you could buy mittens for half the price that would be about as warm and wouldn't require charging.
review.name: A good fit for me

review.reviewBody: I wrote a 5-star review for this after using the gloves for 1 month (see B Brown review). Unfortunately, the product broke after being used for only 2 months--the on/off switch stopped working on the right glove. Worse, when I called OR for service, they said I would need to wait 4 weeks before they would even respond to me! I expect that with some back-and-forth when they finally get back to me, plus mailing delays, it would be 6-8 weeks before I would see a replacement. By that time, the cold weather would be over. What's the point of cold weather gloves if they aren't available in the winter?
review.name: Product Broke

review.reviewBody: These gloves are great for biking! I've used them on around 20 bike rides this year and it has made my winter rides so much more enjoyable. First, some background. My hands get painfully cold when biking below 40 degrees. I would wear a set of glove liners underneath my ski gloves, yet my fingertips would become painful after about 30 minutes. My riding style is a road bike, averaging 13-15 mph for 1 to 2 hours, with intervals of 20-25 mph on downhill slopes. I even tried chemical warmers (my ski gloves had a pocket for them), but no luck. These gloves just solve the problem. They have plenty of dexterity for operating the shifters, brakes, buttons on my bike's lights, etc. The batteries aren't uncomfortable at all - after 2 minutes I hardly know that they are there. Most importantly, my fingertips stay just fine during the ride. When the temp is 32-35, I stay on high setting the entire ride. When the temp is 35-40, I stay on high for 15 mins and then drop to medium. The gloves are good enough without battery heat between 45-50. Above 50, the gloves are too hot to wear even with their heaters off. Some tips, if you buy these gloves. 1. I pre-warm the gloves for 5 minutes on high before each ride. 2. Don't expect your hands to feel toasty warm when you are riding at 12-15 mph and 32 degrees. They will feel slightly cool, but not uncomfortable. 3. The gloves feel very stiff when new. Don't panic. After 5 or so rides, they soften up and feel soooo comfortable! 4. I charge my glove's batteries after every ride. It takes several hours to charge them each time. This is no big deal for me. 5. I don't know how long the batteries will keep the gloves warm. I've never had a problem. I've probably kept the gloves on high for a maximum of 75 minutes (typically 15-45 mins).
review.name: Great for biking!

comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.


If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,

review.reviewBody: What happened to the Latitude line at Marmot. I even emailed customer service asking why that line was discontinued. The new one is small to the size. Can you go back to the original Latitudes Marmot?
review.name: Go back to the original Latitudes Marmot!
comment:

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.itemreviewed: FastFuel DryBag X Top Tube Bag
review.reviewBody: I wish I read the reviews before I purchased.  They are all correct: this bag is too hard to get things into and out of.  It's practically useless for a top tube bag.  A top tube bag is where you want to be able to easily get things out and put things back, like your fuel.  It's called "FastFuel", but it's certainly not.  Your knuckles will hurt reaching into this thing.  And forget having any kind of gloves on.  I must return for something else.
review.name: Opening is way too tight

review.itemreviewed: FastFuel DryBag X Top Tube Bag
review.reviewBody: Super stiff bag body with a zipper "opening" that makes it impossible to put in anything other than maybe credit cards.  I pried it open just enough to slide in a very light shell, one nano-meter of fabric at a time.  Getting said shell out was another matter, however, with the zipper and tiny opening resulting in a torn garment.  I wouldn't even think of trying to get a phone in and out of this thing!
review.name: Don't buy!

name: FastFuel DryBag X Top Tube Bag

description: Buy the Garmin inReach Mini 2 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: inReach Mini 2
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin inReach Mini 2 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago.  I took it on my first solo trip recently. The area I was in had near zero cell service.  It was nice having the peace of mind knowing that if needed I could reach out to someone for help or they could contact me if needed. The only complaint I would have for this device is more related to the service plans. I won’t be using it every month and wish I could suspend the service in the off times without fees.
review.name: inReach® Mini 2

review.reviewBody: It was great to be able to text my wife from the middle of the wilderness.  Last time I backpacked, and had to change my route because of lack of water, she was concerned and I only had the preprogrammed messages available to send.
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody: I bought the in-reach mini 2 specifically as an alternate communication device for when I take my boat off shore.  I was 35 miles off shore and was able to track my position and send messages. The unit I bought was a refurbished in-reach mini 2. My only issue is the battery life is only good for 2, maybe 3 days on a full charge.  I'll be sending it back and getting a new one.  Otherwise no other issues.  The unit came in a generic box with all the parts and instructions.  Then I selected a garmin subscription plan I felt was suitable for my wants.
review.name: Battery life

review.reviewBody: I've just finished my fifth hike with device. I bought it for safety reasons because I hike alone and cell service is not always available. I've steu the device to automatically start tracking when I turn it on. I also purchased the least expensive subscription plan that allows me to use the SOS emergency service and to send/receive 50 text messages by satellite per month. There are two hone apps that is highly recommended, but not required, to make using the device easier. The first app is MESSENGER, which simplifies the sending/receiving satellite texts, the MINI 2 device has no keyboard. The second app is EXPLORE, it simplifies and displays navigation maps on your phone. So the MINI 2 is an emergency communigation AND navigation device. It works, but the down-side is the user interface and tiny screen. It is certainly rugged, and the battery lasts many days. As far as I can find, most of its features are only accessible via the device, but these features are some-what hidden. You should practice and review youtube reviews before any big travels. The confusion of using the device is that from the so called HOME page, you get to options via a MAIN menu AND other options are accessed by moving through PAGES. The manual could be clearer and explain by example what some of the options should be used. It would be nice too if it discussed saving your hike's routes for later use. There are some clever features for example, sending pre-written text's which saves you typing. The software also allows you share your hike in real-time with someone. Soo much to still learn.
review.name: Great Safety Partner
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody:
Was getting ready to go to the Grand Canyon and driving from Southwest Colorado knowing I would be going across the Rez with no cell service for quite some time, I went ahead and did lots of research and read a lot of reviews in the Garmin in reach mini two was my choice
Much easier to set up than I thought, and then in my contacts popped up all the other people that had one which made me feel terrific
Apparently, it is the most popular one!
I owned many other Garmin GPS products over the years and I trust them implicitly!
review.name: Love my Garmin In Reach mini 2
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody: Great way to stay in contact - its light and easy to use
review.name: Great way to stay in contact
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody: I live in an area without reliable cell coverage in many areas. Now I have a way to send check-ins outside coverage areas so my family doesn’t worry, and a reliable way to communicate should I wind up stranded! It’s on my pack for my hikes and in my glovebox when Im on the road. What a great device!
review.name: Works great!
comment: Thank you for your review.

review.reviewBody: My family bought this for me. I have struggled to follow operating instructions. The size of the Owners Manual print is too small to be useful. I am an huge Garmin fan and I own several 12 “ Garmin chart plotters, Montana GPS, Quatix 7 smartwatch, Sportsman 302 Open with full Garmin electronics.
review.name: Painful to actually use
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the inReach Mini 2. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody: Cannot get it to do live tracking to save my life. This is absolutely worthless
review.name: Huge Disappointment
comment: Thank you for your review and experience with the inReach Mini 2. We would like to discuss this further over email. If you would please email us at product.support@garmin.com.

review.reviewBody:
Awesome device..... 
It works when I'm out fishing and my cellphone service doesn't work. When I'm too far from home Hawaii, Molokai. I can still contact to close friends and family that I doing fine.
review.name: It's too small.

description: Buy the OneUp Components EDC Lite Tool System online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: EDC Lite Tool System
hasVariant.description: Buy the OneUp Components EDC Lite Tool System online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Quality, minimalist multitool. Great for basic trailside repairs and install location inside the steerer tube is genius, making good use of otherwise unused space. Is quick and easy to access.
review.name: Easy to install. Just the right tools.

review.reviewBody: As expected, this thing is just so dang easy to install. Very well engineered and a great little solution to keeping a basic tool handy on the trail. Well done.
review.name: Easy like Sunday mornin'

review.reviewBody: I don't really understand why there are no reviews so ill do it for all of you! I think I watched about 1 video on how to install and realized how easy it really is! Just chuck in the long bolt that is provided and wack away with your hammer! once that's done the sleeve just pops right in without problems! Then the tool just pops into the sleeve! It's crazy how this stuff is so innovative and shows what leaps MTB is going to take within the next few years, COVID OR NOT!! The build quality was very good as the plastic, or super neoprene vibrating dampening sleeve is very stiff, and I had zero concerns. The tool also exceeded my expectations as it felt very well built and had plenty of leverage to maybe get a wheel off! Overall 11/10 product! For $40 you won't find anything better that works with almost every stem and works in general!!!!
review.name: OneUp EDC Lite

review.reviewBody:
Like other reviewers, I find the hemline of the jacket to be a little tight which results in a baggy fit from hemline to mid-torso. I am a slim person so it is noticeable.

I would really appreciate having a chest (Napoleon) pocket like many other jackets of this type have.

The jacket is lighter weight than I thought it would be. That’s not to say it’s not warm. It just requires a heavier under layer in the northern MN climate where I live.
review.name: Good mid/light weight layer

review.reviewBody: Very light weight and packable, yet super warm - really glad that I’ve added this to my EDC pack.
review.name: Top notch jacket

review.reviewBody: As others have noted, pretty strange fit on this jacket. Oddly tight at the bottom/waist area, such that I had to slide it up and then have jacket drape over the bottom. Seemed out of proportion to rest of jacket, where the top/chest area was actually fairly loose. I have the SuperStrand LT vest and this also fits nothing like the vest version. Seems like a good jacket if it fits....but make sure you could have the return option, which is what I did!
review.name: Weird Fit

review.reviewBody: Good synthetic jacket for those chilly fall days in the PNW. Also plan on using as an insulating layer for ski days.
review.name: Straightforward jacket

review.reviewBody: Jacket is very warm and regulates temperature very well.  Will use during winter under my uniform top.  Zipper glides smoothly on pockets and main zipper. Color option is fantastic and can be compacted for travel. This item can be used by a beginner that’s just wanting to hike the local trail without a heavy jacket and stay warm as the sun fades.  Can also be used in a layered system for those week long trips.
review.name: Top notch!!

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket about a month ago in the Space Jam color.  I am 6'1", 170 lbs, and I got the medium.  I wanted it to fit a little snug so I could use it as a mid layer when the weather really turns.  The size of it is fantastic.  It is extremely lightweight but warm, perfect for fall or spring.  My only gripe is that the space jam color is a bit see through so you can see the spacing in the insulation, it looks a bit like shadows.
review.name: Light Weight Daily Wear Jacket

review.reviewBody: I took this on a backpacking trip to Santa Cruz Island of the Channel Islands. The jacket performed well. I like that it is packable. The fit of the jacket is a bit off. I'm 46 years old with a 40" chest and an athletic build. The medium size fits my chest but does not fit the hip area. The jacket barely zips over my hips. I have to raise the bottom of the jacket up and fold the top over the hip areas so it's not too tight. I think an adjustable, or an elastic waist would help the design. I think a zipper in the inside top left or right of the jacket would help, this would allow a place to store your phone/wallet or anything else.
review.name: A few changes would make this jacket great!

review.reviewBody: Every product here is so amazing - but the SuperStrand jacket and hoodies are my go to. Cannot live without them!
review.name: THE BEST JACKET EVER!

review.reviewBody: This is my go-to cool weather jacket for walking the dog or hiking. Great for layering and is warm and light. Jacket has a true fit and packs away easily. I'm thinking of getting another in a different color.
review.name: Nice Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is an absolute powerhouse of a jacket. The weight to warmth ratio is incredible . My only complaint, if there is one, is that this isn't the most breathable jacket. But it holds up well in wind. For sub 20 degree weather, this is a good base layer or even top layer. It holds up well from about 25-45 degrees if you're moving around. I get very warm in this if temps are higher than that.
review.name: Lightweight warmth

review.reviewBody:
I have worn these on ~20 rides or so now.  The sole works well with heavily pinned flat pedals, and I have not had any issues with the BOA closure.  

My one complaint is that the low top style combined with the closure system creates a pinch and rub point near the front of my ankle.  It's minor, but not something I have been able to combat with thicker socks, etc.
review.name: One minor issue.

review.reviewBody: I bought these for winter riding thanks to the BOA dial, as i hate tying laces when its 15 degrees outside. I got them a size too large to account for thick winter socks.  I've ridden about 150 miles of trails with these and love them so far. They hold to the pedal really well, only slipped off once on a rugged downhill. These shoes also have the best traction when the need comes to hike a little. Much better traction than any flat pedal shoe i have ever used.  Only negative i have is with the placement of the top wire of the BOA system. Its right at the very top of the tongue, unlike where a normal lace is a little bit lower. When tightened properly, it makes it painful to flex my ankle when pedaling and trying to get the calf to do some work. Its gotten better with time, but i still keep the shoes looser than where i really like. Overall i love these shoes and they are great for what i wanted, even though the BOA isnt perfect in my mind.
review.name: Great Flat Pedal Shoe

name: MTB SHR-ALP RS Shoe - Men's
